meanings.definition: A person or thing that perplexes.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious riddle was one of the perplexers at the party.
meanings.sent2: The group of challenging puzzles were the perplexers at the event.
meanings.sent3: The perplexers in the escape room kept us entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her enigmatic smile was a perplexers to everyone who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The perplexers in the mystery novel kept readers guessing until the very end.

meanings.sent1: The library shelves were filled with various perplexers waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent2: The collection of perplexers on the table intrigued the students.
meanings.sent3: The perplexers on the exam made the students scratch their heads in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The perplexers in the game were like a maze of challenges to overcome.
meanings.sent5: The box of perplexers contained a mix of brain teasers and conundrums.
